definition: did I ever ...? (or "did he ever ...?" etc)
once/already/ever (in the past)/former/previously/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)

sentences.english: Frustrated ever hate carrying solution, greeting Moling go back west.
sentences.chinese: 失意何曾恨解携，问安归去秣陵西。

sentences.english: Have I ever left behind anyone gossamer traces at entire?
sentences.chinese: 我何曾留著象游丝样的痕迹呢？

sentences.english: Have i ever left behind any gossamer traces at all?
sentences.chinese: 我何曾留着像游丝一样的呢？

sentences.english: Have I ever left behind any gossamer traces at all?
sentences.chinese: 我何曾留着象游丝样的痕迹呢？

sentences.english: No, nothing, not even gossamer-like traces.
sentences.chinese: 我何曾留着像游丝样的痕迹呢？

sentences.english: When, though, do we ever address meaningful questions such as, 'What are we all doing here?
sentences.chinese: 但是，我们何曾解答过诸如“我们都在这里做什么？”

sentences.english: We have seen just feel familiar.
sentences.chinese: 我们何曾见过只是觉得眼熟。

sentences.english: And where is the US debate about a commitment that could involve defending these two countries?
sentences.chinese: 美国何曾讨论过捍卫这两个国家的承诺？

sentences.english: No, nothing, not even  gossamer-like traces.
sentences.chinese: 我何曾留着像游丝样的痕迹呢？

sentences.english: There are tea wine more brothers, trouble ever see a man.
sentences.chinese: 有茶有酒多兄弟，急难何曾见一人。

sentences.english: Have I not even left a trace of gossamer?
sentences.chinese: 我何曾留著像游丝样的痕迹呢？

sentences.english: Atually it has ever never been infinite.
sentences.chinese: 其实它又何曾是无限的？

sentences.english: So when do we really have our freedom ever?
sentences.chinese: 是啊，我们何曾有过自由。

definition: old variant of 愷|恺[kai3]/old variant of 凱|凯[kai3]
to ask oneself/to search one's soul/to reach a conclusion after weighing a matter
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
I would like to ask (usually used rhetorically)/one might well ask
